Name: Shabti of Astenkheb
Description: Blue glazed faience shabti, with purple-glaze for the hair and false beard. The moulded details include the hands holding pick and hoe, and a vertical column of hieroglyphs giving the name of the owner, virtually illegible, but recorded in the register as Astenkheb. This is one of a large group of shabtis from a single tomb, as typical for Late Period elite burials.
